name: Hover Junkers
description: Engage in multiplayer VR gunfights that capture real gun play like no FPS you've played before. Pilot and fortify Hover Junkers as you physically walk, duck, dodge and aim in cross ship combat.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel i5-4590 3.3 GHz Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 970 Storage: 20 GB available space Additional Notes: Run on low settings only :(
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 10 Processor: Intel i7-4770 3.4 GHz Memory: 16 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 980 Storage: 20 GB available space Additional Notes: Don't cheap out on your VR PC :)

reviews.review_text: I'm a Crowdfunding backer, it used to be my favorite game.  sadly its dead. no active playerbase at the times i logged in (during the day in germany) for the last couple month. so now i gave up.  how can the devs not notice this? you really have to make it cheaper or find another way to attract players... a multiplayer game without players... is actually anyone working on this or will you just let it die?
This is THE game to have for VR. Also one hell of a fun workout!

Fantastic fun, the priciest but most replayable VR title right now, being a multiplayer VR game.   Your first match in this game will definitely be very intense, it feels super cool and unlike any other VR game I've tried, because you're actually against another person. Seeing other people actually moving like a human makes it feel a lot more immersive and adds a lot of character to the game. There is a sort of social element to this with all of the hand gestures, and stuff like that. It can be really funny to lay down your weapons and mess around with the hand gestures and do stupid stuff, because everyone is so life-like. The social element is really a huge positive for this game.  This game does have a very short honeymoon phase as there isn't a big depth of content, but for my first couple matches it really felt like I was playing the coolest game ever. As you get used to it, it does start to feel quite same-y but the game is still fun and my favourite VR game right now.  I was skeptical from claims about price being too high and lack of content, and I will say that is kind of fair enough, not many weapons right now, stuff like that, but the core gameplay is amazing fun, and the developers are working with community feedback on steam and reddit to provide good updates, like the SMG that is about to be added. I look forward to seeing the game grow, and the singleplayer oregon-trail mode that is planned sounds pretty neat.   Living in Australia lag was fairly noticeable sometimes in matches, but nothing too bad. And while player counts for this game are low, there is always a match available to hop into and you only need 3+ people for it to be good fun. Although I have yet to try the team co-op mode due to only finding FFA matches.  As for performance, this game actually ran surprisingly great for me. Seeing the recommended 970 and 980 was worrying me, but it wasn't too bad even on my 7950 3gb, a card from 2012. If you hold alt while starting the game you can turn down the desktop window resolution and in-game, you can put the graphics down to 'debug' or lower than low. I found the game running surprisingly well with only an occasional fps drop. I also had interleaved reprojection off.    So in short, it runs pretty nicely, no trouble finding a match, social element and VOIP is great fun, very replayable, combat and taking cover is intense, and you can be excited for future updates to come and watch the game grow.   Definitely my favourite VR title, multiplayer puts it on a whole new level.   EDIT: I have since tried team/co-op mode, and it's really cool. It's good fun to interact with a ship crewmate, and shake hands and do silly stuff. Taking turns driving and duel wielding is pretty cool and there's a very social feel where it feels like your teammate is really with you.

So much fun! ok after 3-4 round in the wastelands i am sweating , because it is a nice workout with gunfights. The flying here is not motion sickness making (for me) because there is always a solid ground and many static objects to keep the equilibrium sense in control.  Can't wait for some singelplayer story and meeting you guys on the fields ;-)
Feels like playing FPS for the first time again!

Very innovative arena shooter! This game genuinely revolutionizes what an arena shooter can be. Your character's abilities, are your abilities. If you can dodge, they can dodge. If you can take good cover, they can take good cover. If you can get headshots, they can get headshots. It translates your physical capabilies of gun combat into videogame form, because you are the character. Truly AMAZING!

So far really liking the game, really need to try co op out and put a coule hours into it to write a more through review but if you are looking with a game with pretty good gun mechanics and a fun multiplayer experience I'd reccomend it, Im sure this game will get better every month with new improvements which I'm sure will be the case for many VR games coming out but as it stands think its a great game.  Edit, second day of playing:   Just got done with a 2 hour session. This game is better than I thought, not that I didn't think it was good but man am I addicated after today. The sessions I just had were out of this world. The 1 on 1 fights you get in with players are so real, you do anything in your power to stay alive and kill the other guy. I think I learned the basics of the mechanics and feel really comfortable with the game. Took a couple mins when I first treid it to get my VR legs but once you do it never becomes a problem again, no motion sickness for me.   Haven't been able to test too many social features out yet, joined some random lobbys and played both team and solo death match. I look forward to playing co op with a friend, playing with a random was fun but for I couldn't hear him. If there was one complaint I had it was I could barely hear anyone, both on my ship or in the lobby, maybe there is a setting for it but the game volume is pretty loud and drowns out the voices.   If you thought getting kills might have been satisfying in whatever game you play imagine ACTUALLY getting the kill yourself, so much more rewarding. But man am I glad I plunged and bought it, my favorite Vive game so far. Getting headshots with that pistol is oh so fun.

I bought this game thinking it would be awesome. I was wrong. The biggest offense is that most of the guns have built in spread that makes them so wildly inaccurate its absolutely pointless to attempt to aim. This is 'Spray and Pray: The Game'. No skill involved, only luck. Also, you cant rotate your hovercraft, it's always fixed to its original rotation and you can only fly it around whatever direction it was already facing. The loot and cover system is basically pointless, no one loots anything - they just fly around shooting eachother because there it simply doesnt make sense to be fooling about with junking when people are constantly coming to kill you. So throw that out and you just have people flying around having revolver fights (since the revolver is the only weapon you can actually aim). Lame. Refunded. Maybe I'll pick it up again one day after some patches come out.

I don't really play multiplayer games because I don't have all that much time to put in a single game to get good enough to really have fun but after seeing the trailer I gave it a shot anyways and it was awesome. It's one of the pricier vr games but totally worth it. It's very polished and feels like a complete finished game. With the hovercrafts the devs found a clever way to create a first person shooter in vr without using sometimes immersion breaking tricks like teleportation. And shooters are where the Vive's motion controls really shine. Shooting guns just works like you expect. You can aim down the sights or just fire around your cover and reloading the revolver after blowing up an enemy feels so badass.

At first I was not going to buy it based on the reviews, but it was half off so I went ahead and did. And I must say it was a good choice. The game walks you through how to do stuff very nice, has nice custom graphics, and fun multiplayer. I started with FFA and was delighted. I moved over and tried TDM(Team death match) and had even more fun there. It is fun trying to communicate to your team without using the mic and with hand symbols.   One thing that kinda ticks me off is the shooting. It doesn't go where you think it would. You can be aiming right at a guy and miss 30 shots.   Overall it is a fun experience and easy to overcome and ignore the flaws.

I thought this game was great when the Vive was first released. Now that there are more VR games out, it can't keep up.   My main complaint is aiming. I can never tell where my shots land. I'm sure more practice would help, but it is too frustrating when ever game has at least one, one-shot one-kill, pistol head hunter. In almost every game that I join, one or two people have all the kills.   Driving isn't fun either. There has to be a better way to move around and activate driving.   Each fight is exactly the same. Smash boat into someone else, duck, shoot, die. I also dislike that the ships don't have a rudder to turn. It seems lazy. Some of them you can't see out the back and have to drive them in reverse... how does that make sense?  I don't think it is worth the price anymore. I regret buying it. I would not pay $35 for a multiplayer only game with the amount of inexpensive VR games out today.  Recently someone created a new VR multiplayer shooter game. In ONE WEEK it passed Hover Junkers in the average number of players. It just isn't fun for the typical player. I never was able to figure out how to play co-op games.  I was also a preorder and never got my name on the wall like stated. I followed the directions from the website. Not that I really care.. just disappointing.

I bought a bunch of VR games but ditched Hover Junkers first, because of the price tag. With over 65 VR Titels I can now say: it's well worth it! Among all the current games for the vive there are a lot of promising ideas, interesting demos and satisfying concepts costing between free and usually up to 20 € a piece.   But almost none of them are as well polished as hover junkers, but what's worth even more - few have this level of competition or even a coop mode. Hover Junkers really shows how immersive playing with others can be. How fun competition eventually becomes once you deal with real persons instead of just a chatwindow full of insults and terrible language unfortunately common among most competitive games these days. Part of it might be the 1000 € paywall for proper hardware but I want to belive a good portion also comes with the immersion you get from playing with real peoples in vr. I'd never take a bullet for someone else in cs:source but in hj if I see another player struggling with their controls or the gameplay I almost instantly feel protective and usually jump in without a thought and never regret it.
It's a good multiplayer experience, but this game desperately needs a better tutorial. Some of the controls take some time to get used to.

One of my first purchases on Vive and probably one of the best experiences in VR so far. Very immersive, well balanced, replayable, and showcases game development from ground-up for VR.  Yes Hover Junkers made me sick for the 5 few moments but I powered through and used Hover Junkers to strengthen my VR legs :) now I can play games such as Spellfighter and begin exploring worlds without teleportation.
Two guns, two games modes, best game I've ever played.

I love this game. I love all the different guns and how it uses at the vive controller buttons. I also really enjoy how you have to whip the barrels back into the guns once you reload. The way you hover around is very fun too but makes some people nauseous. It also has some references to Ready Player One which is clever. I say buy this game and come battle me!? -Jwall

By far the best game I have played for VR. It feels like I have been playing for 5 minutes and it's been an hour already. Duck, dodge, crouch, shoot around corners, go ganster mode pistol to the side. Oh yea. I'm lovin it. I put a fan near me and turned it on high so I would feel the wind as I hover. Amazing game. Lobby sucks, all hands and eyes, kinda weird. Looting is awful, hopefully they work on that, but all in all I love this game. Did I say I love this game? I love this game.

This is a great game. Idea is good, mechanics are good and the potential is there for an amazing game. I only have one issue with this game... Other players. Call me bad but every lobby I join (Free for all) will have one player who doesn't armour their craft and is capable of killing me with one shot while moving and over 20 yards away.  Many of you are thinking that I am just bad (which could be true) but when every lobby has one guy going 30 - 4 while second place is barely going 8 - 12 then the game loses it's value.  Oh, also buzz bot lobbies have 10 - 20 minute wait times depending how good the players are. Also a bit irritating.

some bugs and its the only game that makes me feel a bit sick. To be fair, it doesnt get me really sick but i do feel a tiny bit uncomfortable at times. game gets boring after 1-2 games tho, thats for sure.

This Game reminds me of a part of Pandora from Borderlands. a floating platform you or a buddy controls to armor up and take down the enemies. Fun game, that makes you duck for cover, buid defence and try not to get killed.  the yayz! Dualwield weapons in any combinations, but if you do, you cant fly around armor up your hovercraft shoot people in the face shoot through cracks and slots on the ships  I love this game, but the downsides with this game is: Multiplayer ONLY! (no singleplayer or bots) few maps few ships not many weapons (wish there was a weapon loadout) only 3 charactes to choose from pricetag being abit to high for this game  I do not recomend this game today, simply cause the pricetag and the little replayvalue, Overwatch is much better
I put off buying this because I thought it was over hyped and probably over priced but it is genuinely well thought out and beautifully executed. 10/10
WOW this game is awsome at makeing you forget about the real world...love giving people the finger at the bar after the match too.lol
Very fun game. cover is also loot took me a bit to figure that out and i got really dizzy the first round but after that i got used to it.

I am recommending this game despite having returned it. I get motion sickness very easily and I got sick everytime I tried a multiplayer match. However, the shooting, the ammo loading, the gameplay was great for the time I could stand it. I recommend it for those with stronger vestibular capabilities than I.

Ths game is brilliant concept that NEEDS a better execution. Things like a TUTORIAL are really needed, as well as a trial arena or something. How are you supposed to know which ship you want to choose? Everything is wildly inaccurate except for the revolvers, which are not that bad. I really don't recommend this game because network lag combined with the lack of instructions just make this game more frustrating that it's worth.  IF you are really set on playing this game there are things you need to know that the game doesn't really tell you. The blue gun can drive the ship as well as BUILD WITH THE LOOT as well as comms.
The more I play this game the more I love it. Can't put it down. Protip: headshots.

Devs,  You have to work harder on Hover Junkers to justify the heavy price tag. The art is fun and the intent is great, but the realisation is very poor. Aiming, the core mechanic of gameplay, is completely broken! Invisible colliders or any other reasons that make your bullets not lodge into the other player's skull is unacceptable. There also has to be a better way to drive around the vehicles. If we can't have them rotate, do not design them asymetrically. It's just weird and clunky.  Could be a great game, but needs a *lot* more work.

It just gets better and better. With every update, great new contentand refinements. The team didn't take the easiest route, developing this in public, but they did a great job of managing expectations and keeping people excited. We just need more players online!
barely any people playing this, if people did i would still own it

Wow. This is incredible. When you join your first multiplayer match and break out into dance in front of a virtual/real person. Just wow. And then driving these honkin' machines around the desert and shooting at people while crouching to stay alive. WOW!
You can flick people off from cover 10/10
Too buggy and incomplete for the price.
awsome game worth every penny
10/10 would shoot myself in the face again

While I enjoy the concept of the game, I did not enjoy the execution.   Simulation gunplay in laggy multiplayer with questionable hitboxes. Meaning its hard to hit stuff, and when you are playing against more experienced players you are going to last exactly 3 seconds before you're hit. Also found it offputting that even though so much work has been put on weapons simulation, a lot of the weapons are very steampunky/fantasy-like.  Might have been better off as a singleplayer game with multiplayer as an add on. Quite a lot of time can be spent at the shooting range shooting bottles.  5/10 would probably still buy again just to try it, but not recommend it to a friend.
Couldn't get into this game... wanted to like it.
This game makes me immedialtely very, very sick with nausea. It happens due to the hover platform moving with acceleration rather than with linear velocity.

It's a great idea but the movement made me uncomfortable and gave me a slight headache. Your mileage may vary. I might just need to spend more time with it but I'm not sure I want to find out. It took me a minute to figure out how to pull up the guns then later realized there is a tutorial. Im still not quite sure how to get more ammo.   There is a nauseating glitch where you can get attached to another player's ship and get pulled around by their control.   However, it is amazing to see this vast playfield in front of your face and the ability to interact with other players in game ad at the Junker Bar.
Hands down my fav game on the Vive,cant wait to see what the single player add on will be like.

Fun game. It's definitely got a lot of room to grow and improve upon. Flying the ship is a bit odd, but once you're used to it it's not so bad. Graphics are great, only a few dropped frame issues on a 980TI with max settings. Not entirely sure it's worth the full price just yet, but i'm pretty optimistic that it will be down the road.   Downside is very limited rooms of players (though as more VIVE's arrive i'd imagine they'll popup). Multiplayer is required though unless you're in the shooting range, which wears off pretty quickly.

This game is a lot of fun when you actually find a server that performs well. I'm not sure what is going on with Buzzbot games, but it kicks me out for no apparent reason before I die 90% of the time, and I just end up back in the bar with no explanation. I don't get kicked out of TDM and FFA games, but the delay from the moment I shoot to the moment the hit registers is a big problem and immersion-breaker more often than not.   I'm hoping for big strides in 1.2 and 1.3 -- these features seem like they will really take the game to the next level, but currently my review is just MARGINALLY positive. The day the campaign launches and the servers become as reliable as CS:GO or the like is the day I profess this game's greatness, and proceed to play it incessantly.

Hover Junkers is surprisingly far along considering how new the Vive is. Where some other games feel like tech demos, this one has clearly received some polish. There is much more to come, but currently multiplayer free-for-all and team deathmatch is in and it is a blast. It runs mostly stable and has good inverse kinematics so other players move realistically.  The game makes excellent use of roomscale, granting over a dozen ships to choose from, each with a different shape, size, and defensive properties. Small room? Choose a small ship. Large room? You can fly around in a modified school bus! I haven't gotten uncomfortable from ship motion, either, even when someone else is piloting!  All you get in the way of a tutorial is a short information-overloading video and a singleplayer shooting range to test the guns and learn how to reload. Many players get into team deathmatch not knowing they need to loot a coffin to resurrect their shipmate, or not understanding the importance (or lack thereof) of looting junk in the first place.  The voice chat system works well, but it is a bit confusing to configure and easy to accidentally broadcast your voice as you activate it by squeezing the Vive controller grips.

I put off trying Hover Junkers because I'm not usually a fan of multiplayer games or shooters, but the wave of positive reviews finally convinced me to to give it a shot. So far, I don't regret that decision one bit. This game is a blast, and really demonstrates how good a VR game can be.  Out of the handful of Vive games I've tried so far, this is only the second one that's been fun enough and immersive enough to make me completely forget I was playing a game. And it comes with the added bonus of giving you a pretty good workout too.  As other reviewers have mentioned, it could definitely use some more content (more weapons and more game modes), but I'm sure that will come in time. In the meantime, I'm a satisfied customer.

Really enjoyable gameplay! The weapons are fun to use/reload. The online gameplay is fun. The devs are constantly making updates to the game to make it more enjoyable. Cons: The tutorial could be much better... like I didn't realize the shotgun is for destroying cover(sucks at killing people which makes no sense when you 3 feet away from them) This is a FULL VR game, worth the price.

I would love to recommend this game, it has a lot of potential, but I can't. Between constant crashes, poor in game performance, lack of quality players for online, lack of weapons and equipment, this isn't a game that should have been released yet.  Elaboration(and edits) 1. Game disconnects(not crashes as posted above) from servers every few matches and I rarely manage to get through an entire match of BuzzBots without a disconnect. 2. Hovercrafts designed to go forward, back and side to side, there is no turning or up/down it gives a very poor feeling(not performance) to the game. 3. There is a very limited number of players in this game which gives very few options for playing against other players, with a substantial amount of the players seen using tricks like sticking guns through the objects they're hiding behind, this reduces the total number of quality players to a very small amount, making the PvP option at times unplayable. 4. Although there is a road map for the addition af new weapons and equipment, at this point there is only a few making most attempts at strategy laughable.  Wait until much later, when hopefully this is a better performing game. Steam only allows for up or down reviews, and I cannot reccomend the game though I do not think it to be outright bad. Purchase at your own risk.
Awesome multiplayer shooter that basically solves the fast moving FPS problem in VR. Can't wait for single player mode and for more people to get a Vive so I can shoot at them.

Really fun multiplayer. The reloading mechanics feel great. The steering could use some work. Also, this game would be amazing with a single player campaign. Its less 'tech demoy' than other Vive demos, but its still not really a full game. Still really really fun,.
One of the best VR games out there if not the best atm. Worth the money imo.
By far the best game for VR. If you have a HTC Vive you have to get this game. You wont regret it.
Alot of fun but a bit expensive... As more content is added I am sure it will feel easier on the wallet
Very fun but also very tiring because uou'll be ducking, crawling, and dodging in this VR shooter.
We need more people on this! welcome to the world of fit gamers.
Buy It!

I have become somewhat disinterested in regular FPS games over the past several years and the last game I put a lot of time into was BF4 and that was only about 60-70 hrs. I knew I was going to get a VR headset and when I saw some of the content for the Vive, Hover Junkers piqued my interest. Owning a GearVR I knew that artificial Locomotion (character moving while you stand still) can be nauseating if done poorly. When I saw that you are on a Hover craft and that was what moved, I knew I had to have this game.  At this point I only have a couple hours in this game due to the amazing content available for the Vive, but I can say this is super fun. Actually crouching behind cover to avoid getting shot is something that I never thought would actually be a thing. The only thing I can say negative about it is the current lack of content. I know there will be more content coming from the devs so it's not really a negative. I look forward to playing more and actually getting good.
This game is really coming along. At first it was annoying trying to figure out everything, but once I got the hang of it, it was a blast!

I just got my vive, and this completely blew my mind. The gun fights are awsome, you feel like you're really there having a gun fight with people on your hover craft that you are flying around. The devs seem to be active as well, adding updates and content. If you get a vive, this is a must have if you are a fan of shooters, my favorite vr title and now favorite game :) Keep up the good work devs!
Best competitive multiplayer VR shooter out there so far.
This game is great. I played for 90 2 hours straight and broke a sweat. I did not get motion sickness. Really shows off the HTC Vive capability.

Great fun playing along side my friends. Would love to see the possibility of 3 or 4 people per ship for 8 player ship vs ship battles. The menu system is very confusing at first so a short videos tutorial of where things are would be hugely beneficial. Overall a great experience on the vive.

This game is super fun to play. It gives a whole new dimension to VR and how to experience it. The hiding is fun and the reload of the weapons could be a little better, but it also gives the game a fun element not being a 2e call of duty like mass shooter.
Fun FPS game for VR. It features a new way to play an FPS game.
